Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with faded added white and added red bands; exterior reserved with possible accidental black drop; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0936) (phase 2)
